snippet: The massacre of children in Newtown, Conn., appears to be galvanizing the broadest support for stricter gun laws in about a decade, according to a New York Times/CBS News poll.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll reveals that massacre of children in Newtown, Conn, appears to have galvanized broadest support for stricter gun laws in about a decade, far sharper effect than previous shooting incidents; finds that majority of Americans, 54 percent, now support such laws.

byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER and DALIA SUSSMAN
byline.contributor: Marjorie Connelly, Megan Thee-Brenan and Marina Stefan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The massacre of children in Newtown, Conn., appears to be galvanizing the broadest support for stricter gun laws in about a decade, according to a New York Times/CBS News poll.

headline.seo: Poll Shows School Shooting Sways Views on Guns
headline.main: Massacre at School Sways Public in Way Earlier Shootings Didn’t
headline.print_headline:
Massacre Sways Public
In Way Others Did Not
